content:
𝗧𝗢𝗠𝗢𝗥𝗥𝗢𝗪, 𝗠𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗮𝘆 𝗝𝘂𝗻𝗲 𝟮𝟭𝘀𝘁 𝗮𝘁 𝟴:𝟯𝟬𝗽𝗺 𝗘𝗧 👉 One of the most critical steps we can take to curb gun violence in America is repealing the law the NRA has called its “#1 priority,” but you’ve probably never heard of: the Protection of Lawful Commerce in Arms Act. This 2005 law provides the gun industry with an unprecedented immunity from liability that no other industry enjoys, and which has denied families their day in court. I introduced a bill to end this legal loophole and ensure the gun industry is held accountable when it acts with negligent disregard for public safety.

Join me and representatives from Guns Down America, Giffords, and Survivors Empowered on Monday, June 21st at 8:30pm ET for a LIVE virtual discussion on why must repeal PLCAA, hold the gun industry accountable, and give victims and survivors of gun violence their day in court. Register here: https://giffords-org.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_7sRG8XIGQFS2oSy4Ai3__A
name: Adam B. Schiff
text: one critical steps take curb gun violence america repealing law nra called priority youve probably never heard protection lawful commerce arms act law provides gun industry unprecedented immunity liability industry enjoys denied families day court introduced bill end legal loophole ensure gun industry held accountable acts negligent disregard public safetyjoin representatives guns america giffords survivors empowered monday june 21st 830pm et live virtual discussion must repeal plcaa hold gun industry accountable give victims survivors gun violence day court register

content:
Juneteenth marks the day in 1865 when word of emancipation finally reached enslaved people in Texas – providing these individuals with a new measure of freedom. Just as Americans learn the story of July 4, understanding and celebrating Juneteenth as a critical part of American history is vital. June 19 should be a national holiday – I was proud to vote in support of the bill to officially designate it as such, which just passed the Senate this week.

As America continues to grapple with systemic racism, a holiday centered on the story of the delayed promise of freedom has perhaps never been so apt. Take some time today to learn about the history of Juneteenth, celebrate freedom, and recommit to the ongoing work of securing true freedom for all Americans, no matter the color of their skin or their origin.

LATIMES.COM
Hikes, food, music and more. Here are 25 Juneteenth events happening around L.A.
name: Adam B. Schiff
text: juneteenth marks day word emancipation finally reached enslaved people texas providing individuals new measure freedom americans learn story july understanding celebrating juneteenth critical part american history vital june national holiday proud vote support bill officially designate passed senate weekas america continues grapple systemic racism holiday centered story delayed promise freedom perhaps never apt take time today learn history juneteenth celebrate freedom recommit ongoing work securing true freedom americans matter color skin originlatimescomhikes food music juneteenth events happening around la

content: This week is Black Family Cancer Awareness Week. Black Americans have the highest death rate of any racial group in the U.S. for all cancers combined. Black men have the highest death rate for prostate cancer of any racial/ethnic group in the U.S.—more than 2x that of white Americans. Black women have lower incidence rates of breast cancer than white Americans but are more likely to die of the disease. It’s time to close these gaps. To learn more and reduce your risk of cancer, visit: preventcancer.org/sevensteps #CongressionalFamilies #BlackFamCan
name: Adam Smith
text: week black family cancer awareness week black americans highest death rate racial group us cancers combined black men highest death rate prostate cancer racialethnic group usmore 2x white americans black women lower incidence rates breast cancer white americans likely die disease time close gaps learn reduce risk cancer visit preventcancerorgsevensteps congressionalfamilies blackfamcan
